=== Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/10/17 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Milton Katselas'], 'Producers': ['M.J. Frankovich', 'Mike Frankovich'], 'Starring': ['Liv Ullmann', 'Edward Albert', 'Gene Kelly'], 'Studio': ['Columbia Pictures']} Review Text: A 40 year old who looks stunning falling in love with a stunning younger man without all the cheesy gross cougar stuff. No silly plot twist a true love story. 😍

Happily married to an slightly older man (6 months) and I still loved this movie. Review Title: Classic and classy. Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------

{'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Matthew Bonifacio'], 'Producers': ['Stephen Ashkinos', 'Matthew Bonifacio', 'Carmine Famiglietti'], 'Starring': ['Lou Martini Jr.', 'Susan Varon', 'Sharon Angela'], 'Studio': ['FilmBuff']} This was listed as being a documentary and so I started it. It's clearly not, and from what I can tell (I only watched 20 minutes it's not that great of a movie. Not a Documentary {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Joe Berlinger', 'Bruce Sinofsky'], 'Producers': ['Joe Berlinger', 'Bruce Sinofsky', 'IFC'], 'Starring': ['Delbert Ward', 'Roscoe Ward', 'Connie Chung']} I felt this was well done and true. No need to make a story this one tells itself in the footage alone and does a great job. I think it is easy to understand the peoples emotions in this movie and how they feel about the family. Well Done {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Richard Press'], 'Producers': ['Philip Gefter'], 'Starring': ['Bill Cunningham', 'Anna Wintour', 'Tom Wolfe'], 'Studio': ['Zeitgeist Films']} I love a good documentary about talented interesting people and this is one of them for sure. You really fall for Bill's simplicity and his talent. What a neat person. Love him~ Surviving Progress Margaret Atwood (Actor), Colin Beavan (Actor), Mathieu Roy (Director), Harold Crooks (Director) & 1 more Rated: NR Format: DVD Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Documentary ['Product Description', 'Technological advancement, economic development, population increase - are they signs of a thriving society? Or too much of a good thing? Based on the best-selling book a Short History of Progress, this provocative documentary explores the concept of progress in our modern world, guiding US through a sweeping but detailed survey of the major "progress traps" facing our civilization in the arenas of technology, economics, consumption, and the environment. Featuring powerful arguments from such visionaries as Jane Goodall, Margaret Atwood, Stephen Hawking, Craig Venter, Robert Wright, Michael Hudson, and Ronald Wright, this enlightening and visually spectacular film invites US to contemplate the progress traps that destroyed past civilizations and that lie treacherously embedded in our own. Leading critics of Wall Street, cognitive psychologists, and ecologists lay bare the consequences of progress-as-usual as the film travels around the world - from a burgeoning China to the disappearing rainforest\'s of Brazil to a chimp research lab in New Iberia, Louisiana - to construct a shocking overview of the way our global economic system is eating away at our planet\'s resources and shackling entire populations with poverty. Providing an honest look at the risks and pitfalls of running 21st Century "software" (our accumulated knowledge) on 50,000-year-old "hardware" (our primate brains), Surviving Progress offers a challenge: To prove making apes smarter was not an evolutionary dead end.', 'Review', "MIND-EXPANDING... SUBVERSIVE... BRISTLING WITH PROVOCATIVE INSIGHTS. Both brainy and light on its feet, and with wide variety of involving visuals, this mind-expanding ecological documentary bristles with provocative insights and probing questions about humanity and the state of the world. --Kenneth Turan, LA TimesA who's-who of great thinkers are riveting as they walk us through the question of whether we will or can survive progress. --Ernest Hardy, Seattle WeeklyCRITIC'S CHOICE. EXCELLENT! Succinct and entertaining. Weaves together a vast assortment of materials as well as information, to highly watchable results. Do the earth a favor: see this movie, and drag a skeptic you know along. --Dennis Harvey, San Francisco Bay Guardian"] {'Genre': 'Special Interests', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Gary Marcus, Daniel Povinelli, Mark Levine, Marina Silva, Kambale Musavuli, David Suzuki, Harold Crooks, Jim Thomas, Mathieu Roy, Michael Hudson, Victor Zhikai Gao, Vaclav Smil, Jane Goodall, Stephen Hawking, Robert Wright, Colin Beavan, Margaret Atwood, Simon JohnsonGary Marcus, Daniel Povinelli, Mark Levine, Marina Silva, Kambale Musavuli, David Suzuki, Harold Crooks, Jim Thomas, Mathieu Roy, Michael Hudson, Victor Zhikai Gao, Vaclav Smil, Jane Goodall, Stephen Hawking, Robert Wright, Colin Beavan, Margaret Atwood, Simon Jo… See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 26 minutes', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': '25729809', 'Director': 'Mathieu Roy, Harold Crooks', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 26 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 25, 2012', 'Actors': 'Margaret Atwood, Colin Beavan, Jane Goodall, Stephen Hawking, Michael Hudson', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'First Run Features', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} This one really gets you thinking and inspires change. With a great soundtrack to boot (Philip Glass like) Excellent ~ Excellent ~ Peppa Pig: My Birthday Party Rated: NR Format: DVD Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, All Fox Titles ['Peppa is a lovable little piggy who lives with her younger brother George, Mummy Pig and Daddy Pig. Peppa loves playing games, dressing up, visiting exciting places and making new friends, but her absolute favorite thing is jumping up and down in muddy puddles!Bonus Content:', 'Disc 1 - Peppa Pig My Birthday Party:', 'Learn the Alphabet', 'Learn the Alphabet', 'Learn to Count', 'Learn to Count'] {'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': '272270', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Animated, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 20 minutes', 'Release date': 'August 1, 2019', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Stereo)', 'Studio': '20th Century Fox', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Boring. Dull American Girl: Grace Stirs Up Success Olivia Rodrigo (Actor), Eloise Webb (Actor), Vince Marcello (Director) & 0 more Rated: NR Format: DVD Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Action & Adventure ["Grace has a real talent for baking and a passion for making delicious dreams come true. When her mom announces a trip to visit relatives in Paris, Grace isn't so sure about leaving her friends and their cupcake business. That is, until she discovers she'll get to work with her uncle and cousin in a real French pastry shop! But nothing goes as planned and her attempts to help out end in disaster. With some help from her family and a pup named Bonbon, she turns her vacation around. But when Grace returns home, she discovers her grandparents' bakery is in trouble! With their dreams on the line, can Grace find the winning recipe for success?", 'Bonus Content:', 'Masterchef Junior', 'Masterchef Junior', 'Doggie Day Spa', 'Doggie Day Spa', 'Playing Dress Up', 'Playing Dress Up', ']]>'] {'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': '33679142', 'Director': 'Vince Marcello', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 42 minutes', 'Release date': 'June 23, 2015', 'Actors': 'Olivia Rodrigo, Eloise Webb, Caitlin Carmichael, Notlim Taylor, Joe Bastianich', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish', 'Producers': 'Debra Martin Chase, Jean A. McKenzie', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Studio': 'Studio Distribution Services', 'Writers': "Jessica O'Toole, Amy Rardin", 'Number of discs': '1'} Very well done. profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Preferred Genres:** The user enjoys documentaries centered around authentic narratives but has shown a willingness to explore romance, as indicated by their recent positive engagement with a love story. This suggests an expanding appreciation for heartfelt portrayals across various genres.

- **Expectations:** The user seeks genuine representations in media, consistently avoiding sensationalism. Their strong favorable rating for a recently viewed romantic film highlights their standards for storytelling quality, irrespective of genre.

- **Engagement Duration:** This user's critical nature is reflected in their quick disengagement from unsatisfactory content. Their rating of a recent film stands out, underscoring their enthusiasm for emotionally resonant storytelling that avoids common tropes.

- **Rating Tendencies:** They demonstrate a balanced approach to ratings, awarding commendable scores to engaging content. Their favorable feedback for a recent romantic film reinforces their focus on authenticity and quality storytelling.

- **Content Appreciation:** The user values nuanced insights into real-life issues, expressing an openness to emotional narratives that diverge from typical clichés. Their enjoyment of a sophisticated love story highlights their selective yet adaptable viewing habits, emphasizing a commitment to depth and authenticity in media consumption.

Overall, the user continues to prioritize authenticity while expanding their tastes to include romantic storytelling, reinforcing their discerning and versatile approach to film and media.
